1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name           | Process Chemical          | Process Quantity(lbs.)

Ammonia Refrigeration    Anhydrous Ammonia           35,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on t

he PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Description



Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 operates a commercial cold storage facility for table grapes. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigerating capacity to ten (10) cold storage rooms, seven (7) precool rooms, three (3) mini-rooms, and a shipping area.  The rooms utilize bunker mounted evaporator coils that contain chilled liquid ammonia.  A computer system provides substantial control and alarm capability.





The system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each flooded zone of refrigeration, where it passes through a solenoid valve, an expansion valve, and into a low temperature & pressure accumulator vessel mounted behind the bunker wall. From the accumulators, cold liquid ammonia is circulated through evaporator coils. As heat is absorbed, the liquid ammonia vaporizes to form low temperature & pressure gas which is returned to the accumulator vessels. The ammonia vapor is returned from the accumulator vessels through a suction return line to our main suction accumulator in the engine room. From there, it passes through the compressors. The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is cooled, liquefied and returned to our high pressure receiver.  Liquid separated from the suction return gas in the main suction accumulator drains into the liquid transfer vessel.  Operation of a float switch activated solenoid valve raises the pressure in the liquid transfer vessels to the point th

e liquid can be drained into the high pressure receivers.





The facility was originally built in the 1970's. Since then the following significant projects have occurred:

- Mid 1990's - B&W Refrigeration increased the size of the evaporator coils, accumulators, fans, and control valves in Storage Rooms 1-8

- 1996 - B&W Refrigeration installed the refrigeration equipment for the Shipping Room

- Early 2000's - B&W Refrigeration increased the size of the evaporator coils, accumulators, fans, and control valves in Precool 1 and 2



The system contain numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and safety relief valves which vent ammonia gas to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point.  Lastly, an emergency "dump box" contains switches and valves to turn off equipment and vent ammonia if necessary.



The ammonia system at our facility consists of vessels which are interconnected, or which are co-located such that a release of ammonia could impact the ability to operate vessels that are not directly connected. Therefore, we are treating the system as a single process.



1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



1.3.1 General 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders.

 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Sunview Cold Storage - Road

192 facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



This facility has had one (1) accidental release within the last five (5) years.

On July 27, 2013 there was had an accidental release of ammonia. A relief valve on Condenser 1 with a 17 lb/min capacity lifted and remained open for about 2 hrs, releasing approximately 2,000 lbs of ammonia. There were no reported injuries. Thirty off-site employees were evacuated from a nearby facility.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192's ability to communicat

e hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Sunview Cold Storage - Road 192 will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
